title: Smoky Candied Almonds Recipe
full_text:
Smoky Candied Almonds Recipe
Close

Prep
5 mins
Cook
25 mins

15 mins
Cooling Time
10 mins
Total
40 mins
Serves
16 servings
Makes
4 cups
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
1/2
cup
dark brown sugar
2
teaspoons
kosher salt
1
teaspoon
smoked paprika
1/2
teaspoon
cayenne pepper
1/2
teaspoon
Old Bay seasoning
1/2
teaspoon
freshly
ground black pepper
1
large
egg white
4
cups
whole raw skin-on almonds
(about
1 1/4
pounds
; see note)
Directions
Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C), position rack in middle position, and grease a rimmed baking sheet with oil or nonstick cooking spray. In a medium bowl, stir together sugar, salt, paprika, cayenne, Old Bay, and black pepper.
In a large bowl, lightly beat egg white until slightly foamy. Stir in spiced sugar until a smooth batter forms (it will start out looking dry but will loosen as you stir).
Fold in almonds until evenly coated. Spread glazed almonds in a single even layer on the prepared baking sheet and bake until nuts are lightly toasted, about 25 minutes.
Let cool, stirring nuts every few minutes to prevent sticking. Once cool, break up any remaining clumps and serve. Nuts can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week.
Notes
This recipe will work just as well with other types of nuts, such as raw walnuts, cashews, and pecans.
